title: Epitaph for Bipsanios Zosimos
support: Two joining fragments of a marble plaque, set in plaster in modern times.

handNote.lettering: Α with a broken bar, lunate Ε and Σ, cursive M (at l. 2) and Ω, Ψ with a long upright. The cross bar of Η is formed decoratively. Interpuncts at ll. 1, 3 and 4, two ivy leaves at l. 4. Letters at ll. 4 and 5 are slightly larger and separated from the others by a larger space.

provenanceFound._: Assumed to be from Catania. According to Korhonen, the inscription is not urban since it is not registered in the codex Marucellianus A 77.

provenanceObserved._: Observed by Kaibel in Museo del Monastero di San Nicolò l’Arena, later by Korhonen in magazzino del Cortile, Collezione dei Benedettini, formerly sala VI, 106.

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
